subject: Coaches and Managers
lead_paragraph: The first-year coach Michael Curry became the latest Detroit Pistons coach to be fired after the team stumbled to a sub-.500 record and a first-round exit from the playoffs. Joe Dumars, the president for basketball operations, had said Curry would return after the Pistons were swept by Cleveland. Curry replaced Flip Saunders, who went to the Eastern Conference finals in each of his three seasons. In 2005, the Pistons parted ways with the Hall of Fame coach Larry Brown. Brown won a title during his two years with the team.
